intro: Dimorphanthes aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian dimorphanthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Dimorphanthes aegyptiaca is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
